page.title: 09Traffic in the south of area
page.content: Traffic has increased along the B1222 Sherburn-in-Elmet to Cawood road since the development of the Selby Coalfield Four buses per shift take miners from West Yorkshire to the Wistow pit. Cawood Bridge has a weight limit of 6tons but many drivers prefer this river crossing to the toll bridge in Selby,so it is a popular through route from West Yorkshire to York and the east. Much of the area traffic is local- private cars,agricultural vehicles, or delivery vans.The more remote and less populated areas such as Brackenhill Lane,Little Fenton and Biggin are poorly served by bread vans etc.which visit Nanny Lane/Broad Lane regularly. In all areas milk is delivered on alternate days only.Therefore, a car and a freezer are considered necessary by many residents.
